comment: Really nice professor. Class structure was four tests (highest weighted extra 5%, lowest 5% less), with an optional final to replace lowest grade. Couple extra credit quizzes for bonus points through the semester. All the material was covered in class during lectures, material included on exams was a little unclear before each though.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took the 8010 class as a hybrid in summer 2019. The professor is very nice and is definitely available outside of class. I felt like he was trying to cover too much material in too little time. You could tell the majority of students struggled during much of the class based on quiz and test scores. Linear programming needed better explanation
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: lectures are based off powerpoints that he posts online and attendance isn't mandatory so you can literally skip every class except test days and still get an A. weekly quizzes with all the answers on quizlet. he also posts practice problems on d2l. 3 tests with questions pulled straight from the quizzes and practice problems
He is all about the book with his powerpoints, so make sure you know what the book is saying, and he will give you the examples you need for an A in the class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Pretty standard easy professor. I took him as an 8am which was a poor choice, but he tried to make it less awful for everyone. Weekly quizzes were online and easy. Study them and any "additional problems" for an easy A.

His class is extremely boring and you are graded off of 11 quizzes and 3 tests. He gives no mercy for missed test or quizzes. quizzes vary from 15-5 questions. All he does is reads the lesson in a monotoned voice. Also he does not have the best English so some times his wording on the tests and quizzes are hard to understand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Bagchi is a patient instructor, will happily answer any questions in class, email, office hours. You can tell he really knows the subject well. Tests were open book, open notes but if you didn't understand the material you wouldn't do well on the tests. I highly recommend attending every class. A lot of material is covered.

How do I explain how well this man lectures? Dr. Bagchi really knows his subject matter and can relay it to students very easily. His voice is very pleasant to listen to and it helped me specifically to pay better attention. IF YOU NEED A CLASS AND HES LISTED AS A TEACHER TAKE HIM!!!! you wont regret it.

This class isn't terrible, but Professors Bagchi is quite bland with his lectures. Be prepared to sit down and look at power point slides all class with no participation. Has three test that cover several chapters (no cumulative final) which are worth 75%. Just study the quizzes and extra practice questions and you should be fine.

Hybrid class so only one day a week. would take again. 3 tests were worth 75% of your grade so definitely review, none are comprehensive. You have to do well on weekly quizzes because they count as the other 25%. Everything was multiple choice. It's true his test questions come from quizzes but they are worded differently. I studied and made an 85

Super easy class. Weekly homework assignments through D2L. 3 tests throughout (no cumulative final). Test questions come straight from the homework assignments and additional practice problems. Have barely had to study for this class. Class is really boring, but it is not necessary to attend; he posts PowerPoints and notes online. Easy, easy, easy!

OK class. A lot of time spent explaining each concept -- it'd be more effective to work through a few problems.  Exams are straight from class lectures and homework -- so if you do the work, it's an easy A.  If you miss class and haven't had econ before you'll struggle. But, he's very responsive, kind, and available if you need extra help.

Hybrid class was great. I would definitely take Professor Bagchi again. He's funny and the lectures weren't bad at all. The two tests were worth 70% of your grade so definitely review. Make sure you do well on the weekly quizzes because those can make or break your grade if you don't do well on tests. Everything was multiple choice.

Dr. Bagchi's Hybrid course meets one time each week for 1.25 hours, quizzes are on-line and 2 tests are in person.  Professor is knowledgable and available outside of class by appointment.  Course materials are succinct, accurate and helpful.   Print and take notes on the  power points.   Attendance not mandatory, but helpful to grasp content.

No matter what, I couldn't pull higher than a B, and I memorized over 80 flash cards each time. Most of his questions come from the practice and the homework, but they're changed slighty. Make sure you understand the concepts behind them. There is a language barrier, and often students would ask questions and he would give totally different answers

Look elsewhere if you want an interesting lecturer, cause this guy is the most boring one i've ever encountered, as well as having a tough accent to understand.  However, his tests are very easy, with most of the questions being taken from the homework quizzes and extra practice problems.  Memorize those, and you should get through with an A.

He is really helpful when it comes to passing tests. He puts practices quizzes (with answers) online on D2L once before every tests and the questions are copied and pasted onto the test. So, as long as you study those you will do well. He doesn't give any assignments and attendance isn't mandatory. Also, there are quizzes each week online.

He is a very boring teacher. It was hard to concentrate. BUT there is light at the end of the tunnel. I heard most Econ teachers were horrible but he was actually good. Provides notes to follow along with in D2L. HIS TESTS WERE 25 QUESTIONS, which was awesome. homework weekly in D2L. his test are homework questions and extra practice questions EASY
very nice prof. teaches to the point.  makes it easy for students. very caring & helpful. will take again.

TAKE HIM! You don't have to go to class if you review the powerpoints he posts online. I barely went to any classes and made an easy A. Homework questions are all online and test questions are from homework and additional practice problems. He will try to trick you and change up words on the test just pay attention. I'd definitely take him again.

Overall a pretty good professor.  Subject material is very dry and difficult to be excited about.  Professor knows material very well although his lectures are pretty monotone.  Class was pretty good although it's hard to be enthusiastic about econ.

Instruction in this class was too slow and dumbed down.  I assume that most folks in an MBA program have some knowledge of basic Econ, but he lectured the class as if we were high schoolers being introduced to the subject for the first time.  If you want an easy A, this is the class, but if you want to learn, I would suggest another professor.

I took him last semester for Econ 2100. He is a nice guy. He is helpful and easy. When you do your homework weekly, then you will get good score. Because homework and test are kind of same. Just have 3 tests and weekly homework in this course.Good professor though.
Easy Class.  Slow pace.  Tests are representative of the classwork / homework.

This course was challenging, but Dr. Bagchi sets you up to succeed. I had his class once a week for three hours, and the topic was very dry. However, he is a brilliant lecturer and has great examples. There are 3 tests and online weekly homework. Test questions are online before the tests are given. Overall, I would recommend the professor.

stay on it..You have 3 test and weekly homework which is not difficult but you get 25 questions for 4 chaps and if you miss 3 you have a B...you never get a study guide to help tests so you have to read everything then maybe 4 or so questions come from the chapter.be perfect on all test and u wil get an A otherwise just be happy to just pass.
Nice Guy. Helpful even after you are done with the class. Open book exam. Subject could get difficult but he make is easy. A is easily attainable if paid attention in class.

I had him over summer and attendance was not mandatory. He teaches from power points that he puts online. His test questions are directly from  his Hw and extra practice problems. I got a B because I skipped out on some HW. GREAT PROFESSOR!!! Take if you get the chance.

Nice professor! He has an accent but still very easy to understand. The class is extremely boring so i pretty much only went on test days. But if you take the quizzes and study the practice problems you will be fine. They are pretty much the test. I earned a B.
His classes are extremly boring. I ended up teaching myself. If you look over his powerpoints, practice problems, and hw before the test you will do fine.
He doesn't really seem to care, and just goes from his powerpoints, so the class is quite boring to sit through. It is an easy class though, just keep up with the notes and the practice problems
very good professor, read his additional practice problems and online quizzes...then you will definitely be getting an A...highly recommended

Dr. Bags is a really good teacher who understands the material. He does his best to explain the concepts. He gets a lot packed into 1 semester and it felt rushed at the end. The midterm is very easy, the final is a bit more difficult. 20% of grade is homework so get a good group and turn in all assignments. I almost didn't get an A b/c of the hmwk.
Dr. Bagchi was one of best professor I had at Coles. He explains everything clearly and well prepared for class with detailed examples. You can really learn a lot from him.
class attendance not necessary for easy A for anyone with a brain. his lectures are thorough and interesting though.

He explains very well. His class requires analytical and logical thinking rather than memorization. If you can think, the class is very easy. His tests are quite challenging, but if you understand the basic concepts, you will do great.

Nice guy, lectures are easy to follow and he's straightforward with what you have to do.  First test is misleadingly easy, the next ones are tough.  Study and you'll do fine.  Overall a fairly easy class.

Simply put, he wasn't clear enough. I had to go see a tutor to even get the gist of what he was talking about. He didn't explain things well or give you other examples. The class had to constantly barrage him with questions. Economics can be hard, and he only seemed to make it harder.

I was extremely disappointed with this professor.  The book and slides did not help explain the material, so I had to buy another book to help me.  His lectures are difficult to follow and he used different terminology on the test than in class.  He is nice, but I did not gain anything from this class and it was very stressful.

i agree that you take the test, think u aced it, then get your grade back and you make lower than what you expected! gives sample tests but they're a waste of time because the real test is nothing like it! his tests are meant to be tricky and he told me a lot of people drop out of this class and he expects it. his joy comes from torturing students.
Sometimes difficult to understand due to his accent.  Smart man, yet has a difficult time derailing unneeded ignorant questions that waste class time.

You have to go to class to make a good grade...dont even try to study at home and then come in and take test YOU WILL NOT DO GOOD AS YOU THINK YOU WILL..I would study for hours and days and end up getting low B or high C....(however you feel like you aced it) i dont reccomend class and very boring teacher..but he is nice and helpful (very monotone)

Lectures are sometimes a little slow and repetitive. BUT, you learn a ton of info and it's almost impossible to not understand what's going on. Great guy, subtle sense of humor. Would take a class from him again!
He explained everything clearly and very well prepared for class.  I recommend you to his class because you can really learn something from him.
Professor is very thorough in his teachings.  Cares alot for the students - wants to teach to those who are willing to learn.

New at KSU in Fall 06. Very concerned about students.  Repeats things different ways - to the point its annoying.  Career academic & lacks business experience, but very fair and easy. To the point on what you need to know for his tests.
